title: Sources: Cowboys near trade for Bengals' Wilson
content: The Cowboys are finalizing a trade to acquire linebacker Logan Wilson from the Bengals, sources told ESPN.

title: Bucks back Turner with win after ex-Pacer booed
content: Myles Turner was disheartened by the boos he got from Pacers fans in his return to Indiana, but Milwaukee got the last laugh with Giannis Antetokounmpo's buzzer-beater sealing the win.

title: Morant mum on feelings after return from ban
content: Grizzlies star Ja Morant returned from his one-game suspension and had 18 points and 10 assists in a loss to the Pistons.

title: Gannon: Brissett still backup after win vs. Dallas
content: Despite Jacoby Brissett leading the Cardinals to their first win since mid-September, coach Jonathan Gannon said he isn't changing course on his starting quarterback.

title: Sources: Ravens deal for Titans edge rusher Jones
content: The Ravens are acquiring edge rusher Dre'Mont Jones from the Titans in exchange for a conditional fifth-round pick, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Conte, architect of BALCO scandal, dies at 75
content: Victor Conte, the architect of a scheme to provide undetectable performance-enhancing drugs to professional athletes, including baseball stars Barry Bonds, Jason Giambi and Olympic track champion Marion Jones decades ago, died Monday. He was 75.

title: C's Brown irate at apparent no-call: 'Unacceptable'
content: Celtics star wing Jaylen Brown was irate after an apparent no-call late in Monday's 105-103 loss to the Utah Jazz that he said "cost us the game."

title: Peat wows in debut as Arizona beats No. 3 Florida
content: Freshman Koa Peat scored 30 points to lead No. 13 Arizona to a 93-87 win over third-ranked and reigning national champion Florida in the Hall of Fame Series on Monday night.

title: NFL trade grades: Will Dre'Mont Jones upgrade the Ravens?
content: Let's size up deals leading into the Tuesday NFL trade deadline, including the Ravens getting pass-rush help.

title: Updated NFL Power Rankings: 1-32 poll, plus each team's most important game down the stretch
content: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 10. Plus, we picked out critical games remaining on the schedule for every team.

title: Big night for freshmen, more surprises and takeaways from men's openers
content: Koa Peat's 30 points in the Wildcats' win over the reigning champs highlights big night of freshmen debuts.

title: A top-10 upset, Latson's Gamecocks debut and an Iowa breakout
content: Baylor's top-10 upset of Duke and Ta'Niya Latson's 20-point debut helped open the women's 2025-26 season Monday.

title: The real Azzi Fudd?  'None of you have seen it'
content: The Most Outstanding Player of last year's Final Four has shown her peak powers only in small glimpses. Now Azzi Fudd is ready to level up for the Huskies' repeat bid.

title: Why the Cavaliers are doubling down despite two straight playoff disappointments
content: After two disappointing playoff exits, the Cavaliers aren't making any major changes to their schemes or plans. In fact, they're doubling down.

title: Are the Spurs actually a contender? Debating four early-season storylines
content: ESPN national analysts Zach Kram and Kevin Pelton debate the biggest early-season questions about Victor Wembanyama, Austin Reaves, Cooper Flagg and more.

title: Why aren't the Packers dominating everyone? Solak's Week 9 lessons, plus trade deadline bingo
content: Ben Solak sizes up the underperforming Packers, J.J. McCarthy's return, what could happen at the trade deadline and some Week 9 trends to watch.

title: MLB All-October team: The stars who ruled the 2025 playoffs
content: From playoff breakouts to World Series heroes, here's a full squad of players who shined brightest under the postseason lights.

title: From Kyle Schwarber to Alex Bregman: Best fits for top free agents
content: Free agency starts Thursday at 5 p.m. ET. Here are some pairings we'd love to see as this winter gets underway.

title: NHL Awards Watch: Eichel leading for MVP after one month
content: We polled PHWA voters to find out who's ahead in the major races after one month of the 2025-26 season.

title: Buzz: What is Jayden Daniels' injury outlook going forward?
content: Look beyond the fantasy points leaderboard to see who got the carries, the targets and the opportunities.

title: Predicting the rest of the Premier League season: How all 20 teams will finish
content: After 10 games, we now have enough data to predict every Premier League team's final spot in the standings for the 2025-26 season.

title: How much do Bar√ßa depend on Pedri? With midfielder injured, we're about to find out
content: Pedri's injury comes at a critical time for Barcelona and Spain, both of whom rely on his unique skills.

title: First bets for Week 10: Browns and Eagles to cover in Week 10, plus an MVP pick
content: What lines offered immediate value once odds came out? Here are four early bets and a futures wager to track.

title: Pickups: Ryan Rollins, Quentin Grimes add instant offense
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Transfer rumors, news:  Napoli 'aggressively pushing' for Man United's Mainoo
content: A midseason move for Manchester United midfielder Kobbie Mainoo is in Napoli's sights. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: '10% control the Army': Rahul's caste claim in Bihar, says 90% Indians 'nowhere to be found'
content: Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday alleged that 10 percent of the population, referring to upper castes, control the Army and judiciary, while 90 percent from backward communities are excluded from power. He also criticised the Bihar government for unemployment, stating it has turned the state's youth into laborers across the country.

title: Interpol's red notice against cartel heir; wanted in Rs 13,000cr drug haul
content: Interpol has issued a Red Notice for Rishabh Baisoya, a fugitive linked to a massive Rs 13,000-crore cocaine seizure. Believed to be in the Middle East, Baisoya is accused of facilitating drug transportation for his father's international cartel. Authorities are pursuing a global manhunt and a trial in absentia.

title: Watch: Coach collapses mid-match, dies; players break down in heartbreaking scenes
content: Radnicki 1923 head coach Mladen Zizovic tragically passed away at 44 after collapsing during a Serbian SuperLiga match. The game was halted, and despite medical attention, Zizovic died at a nearby hospital. The match was later abandoned as players and staff reacted with profound grief. Zizovic was 44 at the time of his death.

title: ‚ÄòEnsure elimination of all‚Ä¶‚Äô: Himanta links RJD candidate to Osama, warns of his victory
content: Assam chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has targeted RJD candidate Osama Shahab in Bihar. Sarma drew a controversial comparison between Shahab and Osama Bin Laden. He stated that Shahab's victory would be a setback for Hindus. Sarma also discussed his work in Assam regarding infiltrators and madrasas. He announced plans for a law against multiple marriages in Assam.

title: Big AI freebie: ChatGPT Go now free for 12 months in India; how to claim the offer
content: OpenAI is offering ChatGPT Go free for 12 months to users in India starting November 4, 2025. Eligible users include new sign-ups, free-tier users, and existing ChatGPT Go subscribers with accounts in good standing. The promotion provides access to GPT-5, advanced image generation, file uploads, data analysis tools, and custom GPTs at no cost. Users must add a payment method to redeem but won't be charged during the promotional period. This limited-time offer can be redeemed via web, Android, or iOS platforms.

title: Delhi India's 6th most polluted city in October; Dharuhera worst‚Äî see full list
content: Delhi ranked sixth most polluted city in India in October, with PM2.5 levels nearly tripling from September. A CREA report highlighted a sharp air quality drop across the Indo-Gangetic Plain, with Dharuhera in Haryana topping the list. The findings underscore the impact of year-round pollution sources beyond seasonal factors.

title: Maharashtra: Govt renames Islampur in Sangli to Ishwarpur; issues gazette
content: The Maharashtra government officially renamed Islampur in Sangli to Ishwarpur, with the Survey of India granting final approval. This change, following a legislative assembly proposal, aligns with a state-wide trend of renaming cities. While many residents celebrated the restoration of historical identity, others expressed concern, prioritising development over a name change.

title: 'Bachaa hai': Tej Pratap's 'jhunjhuna' jibe at Tejashwi; threatens to campaign in Raghopur
content: JJD chief Tej Pratap Yadav called his younger brother and Mahagathbandhan's chief ministerial nominee, Tejashwi Yadav, "still a child." He vowed to campaign in Tejashwi's constituency in retaliation for Tejashwi campaigning in his. Tej Pratap also criticised Rahul Gandhi, suggesting he was unfit for politics.

title: Jeff Bezos‚Äô ex-wife‚Äôs gift: MacKenzie Scott makes large donation; focus on education
content: MacKenzie Scott has donated $80 million to Howard University, one of the largest single gifts in its history, to support general operations and its College of Medicine. This significant contribution arrives as the university faces delays in federal funding due to a government shutdown. The donation aligns with Scott's ongoing philanthropic focus on diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives.

title: Read: How 9/11 shaped the 'Cheney doctrine'
content: On the morning of September 11, 2001, Cheney was in the White House while President George W. Bush was in Florida. As hijacked planes struck New York and Washington, the vice president was ushered into the Presidential Emergency Operations Center beneath the West Wing.

title: 4 sixes, 93 runs! Vaibhav Suryavanshi's explosive reply to India A call-up
content: Teenage batting sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi impressed on his India A call-up, scoring a rapid 93 off 67 balls in a Ranji Trophy match. The 14-year-old's fiery innings, featuring nine fours and four sixes, showcased his aggressive batting style. Suryavanshi will also feature in the upcoming Rising Stars Asia Cup in Doha.

title: 'Be ready': Mamata leads anti-SIR rally; Abhishek says 'fear claimed 7 lives'
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee led a massive protest in Kolkata against the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls, alleging "silent invisible rigging" by the BJP and Election Commission. The TMC claims the revision, the first since 2002, is a ploy to manipulate voter lists before the 2026 Assembly elections, while the BJP hails it as a transparency measure.

title: China shuts door: Nvidia CEO warns US risks losing global AI edge
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang urged the US government to reconsider restrictions on China, warning that barring the company from the Chinese market risks ceding AI talent to rivals. Despite significant losses in China due to US export controls, Nvidia is securing major deals with the US Department of Energy, including supercomputers for national security.

title: 'A gentle giant': Sania Mirza reacts as Rohan Bopanna calls time on 22-year career
content: Sania Mirza fondly reflected on her decades-long friendship and partnership with Rohan Bopanna, recalling their first title together when she was just 14. From winning the Nationals to reaching the 2023 Australian Open final, Mirza called Bopanna a ‚Äúgentle giant‚Äù and praised his perseverance as the Coorg-born retired at 45 years old.

title: 'War on terror' architect: Former US VP Dick Cheney dies at 84; served under George Bush
content: Former US Vice President Dick Cheney, a key architect of the "war on terror" and influential figure during the George W. Bush administration, has passed away. Known for his decades as a powerful Washington player, Cheney later became a vocal critic of Donald Trump, deeming him a significant threat to the nation.

title: Hinduja Group chairman Gopichand P Hinduja, 85 years old, passes away in London
content: Gopichand P Hinduja, Chairman of the Hinduja Group, has passed away in London. He was 85 years old. Hinduja was instrumental in transforming the family business into a global conglomerate.

title: 'If they make too much fuss ‚Ä¶': Lalan Singh‚Äôs warning sparks row; FIR filed after video examination
content: Union minister Lalan Singh has sparked controversy by urging Janata Dal (United) workers to confine opposition leaders on polling day.  The Rashtriya Janata Dal condemned the remarks, accusing the minister of undermining the Election Commission. This statement comes amid campaigning for a JD(U) candidate currently in jail.

title: 'Put on a whole show about Chhath Puja': Rahul‚Äôs ‚Äòdrama‚Äô barb at PM Modi; takes swipe at Nitish
content: Rahul Gandhi accused PM Modi of staging a Chhath Puja 'drama,' alleging a special pipe was used for his Yamuna bath. Gandhi also criticized Modi for distracting youth with social media, diverting attention from unemployment and health issues. This exchange occurs amidst a heated Bihar election campaign where Modi had previously targeted the opposition over the festival.

title: Blake Treinen‚Äôs viral Charlie Kirk hat: What‚Äôs the real story?
content: A viral photo of Blake Treinen wearing a "Charlie Kirk" hat was falsely linked to the Dodgers' 2025 World Series win. The image actually dates back to a September 12 game, weeks before the championship, honoring a fallen TPUSA founder. Fact-checkers confirmed Treinen did not wear the tribute hat during the World Series celebration.

title: Brittany Mahomes slams ‚Äúdisgusting‚Äù Bills fan stunt ahead of Chiefs vs Bills
content: Ahead of the Chiefs-Bills game, a past incident involving Brittany Mahomes and a fan display in Buffalo has resurfaced. She publicly condemned a disrespectful Kermit the Frog puppet mocking Patrick Mahomes, urging for basic decency. This reminder of respect underscores the intense rivalry, proving that even amidst fierce competition, human dignity remains paramount.

title: IPL trade: What is preventing a KL Rahul switch to KKR - roadblocks in the way
content: Trade talks for KL Rahul ahead of the IPL mini-auction are intensifying, with Kolkata Knight Riders keen on acquiring the wicketkeeper-batter. However, Delhi Capitals are demanding a player of similar stature in return, creating a significant roadblock. DC are already close to a swap involving Sanju Samson and Tristan Stubbs and an uncapped India player.

title: Diversification strategy bears fruit! Non-US markets offset some US export losses
content: India's export diversification strategy is showing early success following a 50% US tariff. Sectors like cotton garments, marine products, and tea are finding new markets in Asia, Europe, and the Middle East, offsetting declines in US shipments. This shift is seen as healthy for India's export growth.

title: Connor McDavid makes history with 1,100th point against Blues
content: Connor McDavid reached a historic milestone, recording his 1,100th career point in the Edmonton Oilers‚Äô win over the St. Louis Blues. The achievement places him among NHL legends Wayne Gretzky, Mario Lemieux, and Mike Bossy as one of the fastest players to reach the mark, further solidifying McDavid‚Äôs status as one of hockey‚Äôs all-time greats.

title: New regional force? Northeast parties announce merger; Conrad Sangma leads charge
content: Leaders from four Northeast regional parties, including Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma, have announced plans to merge into a single political entity. This move aims to amplify the region's voice and represent its people's aspirations. A committee will now define the structure and strategy for this historic unification, though some key regional players are currently not participating.

title: Hydrogen can make water on alien worlds: A study just rewrote how planets form oceans
content: Astronomers now understand that water-rich planets can form internally, even close to stars. A new study reveals that high-pressure reactions between hydrogen and molten rock within sub-Neptunes generate vast amounts of water. This discovery challenges previous notions of planetary formation and habitability, suggesting that 'dry' planets can indeed become 'wet' worlds through internal processes.

title: Diamond jewellery & solar panels! IND women rewarded royally; 297% hike in prize money
content: A Surat industrialist is celebrating the Indian women's cricket team's World Cup victory with a unique gift. Each player will receive handcrafted jewellery among other rewards. This gesture, aimed at appreciating their resilience and inspiring millions, highlights a commitment to uplifting both people and the planet. The team's historic win has sparked widespread celebrations.

title: Explosion at Pakistan supreme court: Gas cylinder blast leaves 12 injured - video
content: A gas cylinder blast rocked the Supreme Court of Pakistan's basement cafeteria in Islamabad early Tuesday, injuring about a dozen people. Authorities confirmed a gas leak and ongoing air conditioning repairs as likely causes. The explosion caused the building to shake, with the most severe injuries sustained by technicians. Emergency services responded swiftly, and investigations are underway.

title: Super Bowl LX backlash as 100K fans petition to replace Bad Bunny with George Strait
content: A Change.org petition with over 100,000 signatures is demanding the NFL replace Bad Bunny with country artists for the Super Bowl LX halftime show. Critics cite concerns about family-friendliness and national identity, while the NFL defends the choice for global appeal, highlighting Bad Bunny's immense popularity and economic impact.

title: '43yrs in maximum-security prison': Indian-origin man wrongly jailed in US; court halts deportation
content: Indian-origin man, Subramanyam Vedam, faces deportation from the US after spending over four decades in prison for a murder conviction later overturned.  Despite being a legal permanent resident since infancy, he was taken into immigration custody upon release. Courts have now halted his deportation, offering a glimmer of hope for the exonerated man.

title: San Francisco‚ÄìDelhi flight: Air India to send relief plane; 228 stranded in Mongolia
content: Air India is dispatching a special relief flight to Ulaanbaatar to bring back 228 passengers stranded after their San Francisco-Delhi flight diverted due to a technical issue. The Boeing 787 Dreamliner will ferry the passengers home on Wednesday. The airline is ensuring passenger comfort and safety while the original aircraft undergoes checks.

title: ‚ÄòRs 100 crore assets‚Äô: UP DySP hidden empire busted; SIT links him to Kanpur extortion gang
content: A Deputy Superintendent of Police in Uttar Pradesh, Rishikant Shukla, faces a vigilance inquiry after an SIT probe uncovered nearly ‚Çπ100 crore in alleged illegal wealth. The investigation revealed links to a Kanpur-based lawyer's extortion syndicate, which reportedly used fabricated cases and land grabbing. Shukla's assets are deemed disproportionate to his known income.

title: Kayla Harrison net worth 2025: UFC career, earnings, and latest match updates
content: Kayla Harrison, a two-time Olympic judo champion, has conquered the UFC, clinching the women's bantamweight title in June 2025. Her impressive victory over Julianna Pe√±a, secured by submission, has cemented her status as a formidable force in mixed martial arts.  Harrison's journey, marked by dedication and a winning spirit, continues to inspire.

title: 'A Quiet Place: Day One': OTT release date and where to watch the Lupita Nyong'o starrer
content: A Quiet Place: Day One, starring Lupita Nyong'o and Joseph Quinn, is now available on Netflix. The film explores the beginning of the alien invasion in New York City. Critics have given it a mixed review. Meanwhile, A Quiet Place Part III, directed by John Krasinski, has had its release date moved to July 30, 2027.

title: 'Never stop dreaming': Harman‚Äôs heartfelt message after historic World Cup win ‚Äì watch
content: Harmanpreet Kaur's childhood dream materialized as India clinched their maiden World Cup title, defeating South Africa by 52 runs. Recalling her humble beginnings with a modified bat, Kaur emphasized the power of unwavering dreams and perseverance.

title: Bihar: Bridge collapses in Araria; built in 2019 for Rs 4 crore, traffic movement halted
content: A middle pillar of a four-crore rupee bridge in Bihar's Araria district collapsed on Monday, causing no injuries. The bridge, built in 2019 and connecting Forbesganj with Pategna village, has had all traffic halted. A technical team is investigating the incident, which follows a dozen bridge collapses in the state last year.

title: 'Seven cut out of my face': Michael Clarke reveals long battle with cancer
content: Former Australian cricket captain Michael Clarke has revealed his ongoing battle with skin cancer, having had multiple melanomas and cancerous spots removed from his face and body since 2006. He recently underwent another procedure for a lesion on his nose, emphasizing the importance of regular check-ups and early detection due to years of intense sun exposure during his playing career.

title: Paige Spiranac gets emotional over how online hate ruined her dream career
content: Golf influencer Paige Spiranac shared a disturbing online message. She became emotional discussing the impact of hate. Spiranac detailed her efforts at The Internet Invitational. Negative comments brought back insecurities. She spoke about the hidden cost of fame and online negativity. She took to her Instagram and shared a screenshot of the disturbing message and explained the entire matter about it in the following slides.

title: Former Karnataka minister and senior Congress leader HY Meti passes away
content: Former Karnataka excise minister and senior Congress leader H.Y. Meti has passed away at 79. A five-time MLA and one-time Lok Sabha member, Meti was a prominent figure in North Karnataka politics. He had previously resigned from the cabinet in 2016 following a controversy.

title: 'Gutted!': Ashwin ruled out of BBL; Thunder issue statement on injury
content: Indian spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has been ruled out of the upcoming Big Bash League season due to knee surgery. Sydney Thunder expressed disappointment but hopes Ashwin can still contribute later in the tournament. Ashwin, also disappointed, aims to recover and return stronger, expressing gratitude for the club's support and warmth from fans.

title: IPL Auction: SRH to release Klaasen? Franchises keep tabs on ex-Proteas batter
content: Heinrich Klaasen, retained for Rs 23 crore, produced 487 runs in IPL 2025 but majority of his runs came in two knocks with rest littered in cameos. A season prior, he scored four fifties in run to the final for SRH. Going into the mini auction next month, Klaasen could be released to beef up the purse.

title: Exclusive: Sonakshi Sinha opens up about interfaith wedding with Zaheer Iqbal
content: Sonakshi Sinha and Zaheer Iqbal, married in June 2024, have become a beloved B-town couple, with Sinha emphasizing that love triumphs over hate.  They recently humorously addressed pregnancy rumors and Sinha also commented on weight gain post-marriage, attributing it to marital happiness.

title: Diane Ladd dies at 89: Battled a life-threatening lung illness six years ago
content: Veteran actress Diane Ladd, celebrated for her roles in 'Chinatown' and 'Alice Doesn't Live Here Anymore,' has passed away at 89. Her daughter, Laura Dern, confirmed her mother's peaceful passing at home. Six years prior, Ladd bravely battled a life-threatening lung disease, idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, a struggle she and Dern later shared, highlighting their strengthened bond.

title: Way-too-early NBA All-Star predictionsÔªø: Which new faces will we see in L.A.?
content: the 2025-26 season is young, but it's not too early to start thinking about which players have a chance to join that group . jamal Murray has averaged more points in his playoff career (23.8) than Wilt Chamberlain (22.5), James Harden (22.3), Dwyane Wade (22.3) and Kawhi Leonard (21.6)

title: Resetting the CFP tiers after Week 10 and projecting the first bracket
content: two top-10 teams fell on the road to unranked opponents . a third fell to a lower-ranked team . two-thirds of the 2025 college football season done, we now shift into Playoff Hyperdrive .

title: Tracking every NFL trade deadline move: Logan Wilson to the Cowboys
content: the 2025 NFL trade deadline is Tuesday at 4 p.m. ET . we have you covered on every deal until the final second . the seahawks are an intriguing team to watch ahead of today's deadline .

title: üèà CFB Power Ranking: Oregon moves into top 5
content: arch Manning waited until the last possible second before firing the ball to a leaping Emmett Mosley V in the end zone . the longhorns held on for a 34-31 win . he has 674 passing yards and six touchdowns in his past two starts .

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in? Who's out? Who's close ahead of first committee ranking?
content: the college football playoff selection committee will reveal its first ranking on tuesday . teams with Would be in status below are featured in this week's top 12 projection . the 12-member selection committee doesn't always agree with the Allstate Playoff P .

title: Barnwell: Two days after Halloween, four Super Bowl contenders proved to be not-so-scary
content: four of the five favorites to win this season's title by ESPN's Football Power Index lost on Sunday . the only team in the top five to make it through the weekend unscathed was the Eagles -- who were on bye . each team has at least two losses on its record by week 9 .

title: Cardinals snap losing streak, beat Cowboys in Dallas
content: the Arizona Cardinals beat the Dallas Cowboys 27-10 on "Monday Night Football" the Cardinals' offense looked better and more efficient, both statistically and to the naked eye . the offense topped 300 yards for the third straight game after hitting the mark just once .

title: "I Sent 13 Girls Back": Podcaster Warns Against Sending Children To Canada
content: Author and podcaster Kushal Mehra has revealed that he helped 13 Indian girls return home after they fell victim to human trafficking in Canada.

title: Speaking In Bengali Does Not Mean Bangladeshi: Mamata Banerjee Slams BJP
content: Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee held a massive footmarch in Kolkata against the Special Intensive Revision of voter list that was rolled out by the Election Commission today across a number of states.

title: Air Pollution Linked To 15% Of All Deaths In Delhi In 2023, Finds Study
content: Air pollution was responsible for nearly 15 per cent of all deaths in Delhi in 2023, making it the city's single largest health risk, according to an analysis of the latest Global Burden of Disease (GBD) data.

title: How 'admin123' Led To Hospital Footage Of Women Being Uploaded On Porn Sites
content: A lack of digital housekeeping led to footage of women undergoing gynaecological checkups at a maternity hospital in Gujarat's Rajkot being uploaded to porn websites, an investigation has revealed.

title: Prashant Kishor Takes Aim At Tejashwi Yadav, Asks About 'Retirement Plans'
content: Jan Suraaj founder Prashant Kishor on Tuesday aimed at the Rashtriya Janata Dal leader Tejashwi Yadav, mocking him for making 'tall' poll promises.

title: Adani Enterprises' Profit Grows 84% On One-Time Gains In 2nd Quarter
content: Adani Enterprises reported an 84 per cent jump in profit in the September quarter, mainly because of a one-time exceptional income, without which the core earnings dipped on weakness in its mainstay coal trading division

title: Star-Eating Black Hole Unleashes Record-Setting Energetic Flare
content: Scientists are observing the most energetic flare ever seen emanating from a supermassive black hole, apparently caused when this celestial beast shredded and swallowed a huge star that strayed too close.

title: Digvijaya Singh's "Innocent" Remark For Umar Khalid Sparks BJP Backlash
content: Former Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister and senior Congress leader Digvijaya Singh has stirred fresh controversy after describing former JNU scholar Umar Khalid, who has been in jail since 2020, as "innocent" and demanding his release.

title: Delhi Risks 50 Degree Celsius Heat Without Decarbonisation: Ex-Minister
content: Former Union Minister Jayant Sinha on Monday warned that Delhi could experience extreme temperatures of around 50 degrees Celsius in the future if India fails to take urgent and decisive action towards decarbonisation.

title: Local Body Polls Looming, Maharashtra Cabinet Takes 21 Decisions In A Day
content: With elections to local bodies looming, the Maharashtra cabinet took 21 decisions, an unusual number for a single meeting, including the closure of the state's asset reconstruction company, MAHA ARC Limited.

title: Flooding From Typhoon Kalmaegi Kills 26 In Philippines, Thousands Stranded
content: At least 26 people have been killed and hundreds of thousands displaced as rains driven by Typhoon Kalmaegi flooded swathes of the central Philippines.

title: Parties Start Declaring Candidates For Elections In Bangladesh, BNP Takes Lead
content: Bangladesh has taken a step closer to elections with one of the main parties in the fray, the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP), announcing candidates for the elections that are scheduled in February next year.

title: Australia To Offer Hours Of Free Solar Power
content: Australian households will be able to access three hours a day of free solar power under an energy-saving programme that will begin next year.

title: Ex-Minister On Why He Didn't Speak To Mumbai Hostage Taker, Despite His Demand
content: During the three-hour hostage crisis in Mumbai in which 17 children and two adults were held captive by filmmaker Rohit Arya at a studio, he kept asking to speak to former school education minister Deepak Kesarkar.

title: On Camera, Reality Show Dancer Killed As Truck Rams Parked Car Near Bengaluru
content: A 36-year-old dancer, who appeared in several television reality shows, was killed after a truck rammed into him when he stopped his brand new car on the side of a highway to investigate a snag.

title: DMK Takes Back Ex-Minister Ousted From Party Over "Disgusting" Remarks On Women
content: Former Tamil Nadu Forest Minister and senior DMK leader K Ponmudy, who was sacked from his party position over misogynistic remarks in April this year, was reinstated as one of the party's Deputy General Secretaries on Tuesday.

title: Hyderabad Woman Kidnaps Husband, Demands 1 Crore. She Planned To Kill Him
content: Telangana Police have arrested 10 people, including a woman, for allegedly kidnapping her husband and demanding a Rs 1 crore ransom in Hyderabad. Three cars, two two-wheelers, and several cell phones were seized from the accused.

title: "No Brother In Battleground, Only Enemy": 'Fredo' Tej Pratap Yadav's War Cry
content: Social media handles are drawing parallels between the Godfather character and Tej Pratap Yadav, Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) patriarch Lalu Yadav's eldest son

title: Jesus, Not Virgin Mary, Saved The World, Vatican Says
content: Jesus may have heard words of wisdom from his mother Mary, but she did not help him save the world from damnation, the Vatican said on Tuesday.

title: Give Rs 2,000 Notes, Make Money Rain: Scam Busted In Bengaluru, 10 Arrested
content: Police have arrested ten people for allegedly cheating the public by collecting withdrawn Rs 2,000 denomination notes from unsuspecting citizens and promising to make it rain money through rituals.

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: a blackout of ESPN and other Disney-owned channels, such as ABC, has been reported . the conflict affects ABC, the ESPN netwo and the foxes . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services .

title: Free agent pickups: Key adds ahead of Week 10
content: the ninth Sunday of the season featured a wild, defenseless slugfest in Buffalo . preseason top tight end Brock Bowers scored three touchdowns and a league-high 43.3 PPR points . cam Little blasted the longest field goal in NFL history .

title: Chhattisgarh: 4 killed as passenger train collides with goods train near Bilaspur - video
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." title: Medical PG student‚Äôs rented room turns into drug storage and sales hub
content: Dr. Joseph Paul, 29, a final-year student in forensic medicine was arrested by State Task Force (STF) officials who seized synthetic and imported narcotics worth around ‚Çπ3 lakh from his room

title: CPI(M) seeks establishment of Sports University in Andhra Pradesh
content: In letter to HRD Minister Lokesh, party State secretary Srinivasa Rao says such a facility will help promote sports and nurture talent at the grassroots

title: Talks between sugarcane growers and management of factories hit a deadlock in Belagavi
content: Talks between farmers and the management of sugar factories hit a deadlock after they failed to reach an agreement over the price to be fixed for sugarcane this season

title: Telangana, Cuba keen on forging strong ties
content: IT and Industries Minister D. Sridhar Babu and Ambassador of Cuba Juan Carlos Marsan Aguilera discuss scope for collaboration in biotech, pharma, healthcare, AI, IT, innovation, agriculture, sports and culture

title: Women abused, shamed, and silenced online by technology-facilitated gender-based violence, says report
content: India needs stronger online safety laws, faster removal of abusive content, and more accountability from tech platforms, a report by international human rights organisations highlights

title: Attacks against tourists, hours-long traffic blocks, lack of basic amenities, exploitation of visitors a blot on Munnar‚Äôs tourism landscape
content: Munnar did not see a surge of tourists this last Deepavali season, which does not bode well for the future of the tourist destination

title: Incapable DMK administration led to breakdown of law and order in T.N., alleges Nainar Nagenthran
content: By merely shooting and catching the accused, what is the use, asks BJP leader in response to the arrest of Coimbatore gang-rape accused

title: Hyderabad gets 24x7 postal booking counters at railway stations, airport
content: The initiative allows citizens to access a range of postal services, including Speed Post, parcels, business mail and other postal facilities, at any hour

title: Special programme to address land, revenue issues in Annamayya district soon, says Collector
content: Roads and Buildings (R&B) Minister lauds the Collector‚Äôs initiative, calling it a ‚Äôcitizen-focused and result-oriented step‚Äô towards resolving grassroot-level issues

title: Hours after switching from AIADMK to DMK, Manoj Pandian resigns¬†as MLA in Tamil Nadu
content: He claims the AIADMK is functioning as a wing of the BJP; accuses AIADMK general secretary Palaniswami of preventing him from speaking in the Assembly

title: APCRDA invites citizens‚Äô ideas in preparing Vision-2047 for the capital region
content: The initiative seeks to build a collective roadmap that reflects the spirit, strength, and dreams of Andhra Pradesh

title: Police probe if smoking dispute led to suspect pushing woman out of moving train in Kerala
content: The police said Suresh Kumar struck Sreekutty on the back with his foot, propelling her out of the running train.¬†

title: Police rescue Gurukul school student in Kadapa
content: Police found the 14-year-old boy safe near Gandi Anjaneya Swamy temple in Kadapa district, bringing an end to a four-day search

title: Rival groups clash over road rage incident in Bengaluru, several injured
content: The police have registered a case against several people, charging them under attempt to murder and the Arms Act.

title: T.N. Commission for Women recommends criminal action against chef-actor Madhampatty Rangaraj
content: Joy Crizildaa, a popular costume designer in Tamil cinema, had lodged a complaint against Rangaraj in August, after announcing their marriage and her pregnancy on social media.

title: Congress warns the U.S.‚Äôs HIRE Bill could ‚Äòlight a fire‚Äô in the Indian economy
content: The Halting International Relocation of Employment Bill would have a direct and deep impact on India‚Äôs IT services, BPO, consulting and Global Capability Centres, Congress general secretary Jairam Ramesh cautioned

title: Four killed, several injured in Bilaspur train accident
content: The railway authorities have moved all the resources at the spot, and all measures are being taken to treat the injured persons, a railway spokesperson said

title: Maharashtra civic body elections on December 2, results on December 3
content: Maharashtra State Election Commission has announced the schedule for Nagar Panchayat and Nagar Parishad elections; schedule is yet to be declared for 29 municipal corporations, 32 zilla parishads, and 336 panchayat samitis, where polls are due

title: German firm Deutsche Borse to launch GCC in Hyderabad, provide at least 1,000 jobs
content: The German Consul General was requested to appoint teachers and help in teaching German language to Telangana students

title: NDA will secure record win, ‚Äòjungle raj people‚Äô will suffer their worst defeat: PM Modi
content: Mr. Modi said he is addressing rallies in Bihar and every rally is breaking the record of the previous one, with women coming in very large numbers

title: Hinduja Group Chairman Gopichand Hinduja passes away in London
content: Gopichand, who belonged to the second generation of the Hinduja family, took over as chairman following the death of his elder brother Srichand in May 2023

title: Trace Mahadev betting app promoter Ravi Uppal, SC directs ED
content: Additional Solicitor General S.V. Raju informed the top court that Mr. Uppal had fled from Dubai to an unknown location and is currently untraceable

title: Telangana AI Innovation Hub unveiled, set to drive multi-sector innovation, research and partnerships
content: Primary goal behind setting up TAIH is to ensure by 2035 Telangana finds a place among the top 20 AI hubs in the world, says IT Minister Sridhar Babu

title: Dhoni‚Äôs presence in Madras High Court will require elaborate security arrangements, say judges
content: Uphold the appointment of an advocate commissioner to record his evidence elsewhere and dismiss an appeal filed by retired IPS officer Sampath Kumar against such appointment

title: India, Israel discuss anti-terror cooperation, ways to boost trade ties
content: It is learnt that the implementation of the India-Middle East-Europe Economic Corridor (IMEC) came up for discussion in the context of boosting regional connectivity

title: Cough syrup deaths: MP SIT arrests accused doctor‚Äôs wife; booked for hiding proof, aiding husband
content: wife of arrested govt doctor is accused of tampering and destroying key evidence . she ran a medical store in her name and had been on the run for weeks . the toxic batch of the syrup was found to contain 48.6% diethylene glycol (DEG)

title: SIR 2.0: Mamata tears into BJP, ECI; warns of Modi govt‚Äôs fall if one eligible voter struck off rolls
content: The Trinamool Congress has dubbed the exercise ‚Äúsilent invisible rigging‚Äù by the BJP-led Centre and the Election Commission

title: Spurious liquor case: former minister Jogi Ramesh, his brother in Nellore jail
content: YSRCP leaders Kakani Govardhan Reddy, Parvathareddy Chandrasekhar Reddy and hundreds of activists reached the jail premises to meet Jogi brothers

title: No awards for children‚Äôs cinema at Kerala State Film Awards spark row
content: Move faces criticism from filmmakers and child actor. Jury, led by actor-filmmaker Prakash Raj, defended their decision, stating that submitted films failed to present a child‚Äôs perspective. Cultural Affairs Minister vows to engage industry stakeholders to promote higher-quality children‚Äôs cinema in future

title: FIR filed against JD(U)‚Äôs Lalan for making controversial remarks against Opposition leaders in Bihar
content: Union minister Rajiv Ranjan Singh on November 4, landed in a fresh controversy with the surfacing of a video in which he can be purportedly heard asking NDA supporters to intimidate the opponents on polling day.

title: Sikh pilgrims from India enter Pakistan, first major crossing since Pahalgam attack
content: More than 2,100 pilgrims were granted visas to attend a 10-day festival marking 556th birth anniversary of Guru Nanak, Pakistan‚Äôs High Commission (embassy) in New Delhi said

title: PMK MLA Arul‚Äôs car attacked in Salem during clash between supporters of Anbumani and Ramadoss
content: ‚ÄúThey attacked the car with stones, wooden¬†logs, and iron rods. If I had come out of the car, they would have killed me,‚Äù the MLA claimed.

title: Supreme Court concerned over misuse of POCSO cases, says awareness needed
content: Supreme Court raised concerns about the misuse of the POCSO Act in marital disputes and urged awareness campaigns, as a PIL highlighted gaps in understanding sexual offence laws

title: Women‚Äôs World Cup: Maharashtra to felicitate Jemimah Rodrigues, Smriti Mandhana and Radha Yadav
content: On November 2, 2025, the Indian women‚Äôs cricket team won its maiden World Cup title, defeating South Africa in the final at Navi Mumbai

title: Former Karnataka minister H.Y. Meti passes away in Bengaluru
content: Meti, an influential Kuruba community leader from Northern Karnataka, was elected to the Legislative Assembly in 1989 and 2004. He served as the Excise Minister in the previous Siddaramaiah government (2013-18).

title: Mandhana, Jemimah, Deepti named in ICC Women's World Cup Team of Tournament
content: Named Player of the Tournament, Deepti was instrumental in India's title-winning campaign; she finished as the leading wicket-taker and scored crucial runs across the tournament.

title: Watch: Coimbatore assault case: Three arrested, shot while fleeing police
content: Police in Coimbatore arrested three men accused of sexually assaulting a 20-year-old college student near the city‚Äôs international airport on November 2. Officials said the suspects were shot in the legs when they tried to escape during the operation.

title: ED searches in Nagaland human hair export FEMA case
content: Despite considerable lapse of time, the company failed to submit requisite export documentation such as shipping bills, export invoice copies amongst others to the authorised dealer bank within prescribed timelines, ED officials said.

title: Women‚Äôs World Cup: PM Modi to felicitate Indian squad on November 5
content: The Board of Control for Cricket in India is unlikely to organise a victory parade for Harmanpreet‚Äôs Hurricanes

title: In challenge against SIR expansion, DMK flags exercise infringes voters' right to political expression
content: The DMK has challenged the Election Commission‚Äôs electoral roll revision in 12 States, claiming it threatens voter rights and undermines fair elections, warning of potential disenfranchisement

title: Passenger detained for trying to open emergency exit on flight at Varanasi airport
content: As the aircraft was taxiing towards the runway, the passenger, Sujit Singh, a resident of Gaura Badshahpur in Jaunpur district, attempted to open the emergency exit, police said

title: West Bengal school recruitment¬†scam: School Service Commission publishes list of ‚Äòtainted‚Äô non-teaching staff
content: 3000 ‚ÄòUntainted‚Äô question why they are being punished even when WBSSC has the list of ‚Äòtainted‚Äô candidates; raise concern over non-payment of salary over last 8 months

title: Cough syrup tragedy: SIT arrests wife of accused Dr. Praveen Soni
content: Jyoti Soni is the proprietor of a medical shop from where the cough syrup was sold to several victims, the official said.

title: CM Revanth to lay foundation for Akshaya Patra mega kitchen spread over 2 acres in Telangana‚Äôs Kodangal
content: The foundation has already been implementing the breakfast scheme in Kodangal since December, serving over 28,000 students across 312 schools

title: ‚ÄòI am broken‚Äô: Sole survivor of Air India Ahmedabad plane crash appeals for welfare package
content: Radd Seiger, a UK-based retired lawyer, has taken charge as Ramesh‚Äôs spokesperson and appealed to Air India CEO Campbell Wilson to meet with the family to be able to fully assess and address the gravity of the situation.

title: AIADMK rebel MLA Manoj Pandian joins DMK
content: Mr. Pandian said he would resign from his MLA post later in the day; his defection is seen as setback to O. Panneerselvam, who recently gained the support of K.A. Sengottaiyan

title: Three elephants rescued after falling into well in Chhattisgarh wildlife sanctuary
content: ‚ÄúThe incident was reported in the morning at Hardi village in the wildlife sanctuary,‚Äù Principal Chief Conservator of Forests (Wildlife) Arun Kumar Pandey said

title: 27 injured in Telangana‚Äôs Karimnagar RTC bus-tractor crash; 4 hurt in Nalgonda private bus-tractor accident
content: The accidents occurred a day after 19 people died in RTC-tipper lorry crash in Chevella of Rangareddy

title: India's top 1% grew its wealth by 62% since 2000: G20 report
content: The study, led by Nobel laureate Joseph Stiglitz, warns that global inequality has reached "emergency" levels

title: No charges on cancellation within 48 hours: DGCA proposes significant changes to air ticket refund norms
content: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has proposed that in case of purchase of a ticket through a travel agent/portal, the "onus of refund shall lie with the airlines‚Äù

title: Watch: What to know about Election Commission‚Äôs voter list revision 2.0 | Explainer
content: The Election Commission has begun the second phase of its Special Intensive Revision of Electoral Rolls, covering over 51 crore voters across 12 states and Union Territories. In this explainer, Sreeparna Chakrabarty looks at what‚Äôs different this time and what it means for voters.

title: T.N. MLA Sengottaiyan urges ECI to expedite inquiry into ‚ÄòTwo Leaves‚Äô symbol issue
content: Sengottaiyan tells ECI that the faction led by Edappadi K. Palaniswami does not represent the original AIADMK

title: Voting goes underway for JNUSU elections
content: Counting will begin at 9 p.m., and the final results will be declared on November 6, according to the election committee.

title: CPJ seeks security for journalist Rana Ayyub and her father
content: ‚ÄúThe threats of violence made against Rana Ayyub and her father from an unknown international number are deeply concerning,‚Äù said CPJ‚Äôs India representative Kunal Majumder

title: Fugitive Mehul Choksi challenges extradition in Belgium Supreme Court
content: India has given a number of assurances to Belgium regarding Choksi's safety, the charges that he would face during trial in India, prison arrangements, human rights and medical needs.

title: Magnitude 4 earthquake in Andhra‚Äôs Alluri District, gives tremors to residents in nearby Vizag city
content: ‚ÄúI felt a few jolts in my bed. I woke up immediately and got up.  I did not feel much,‚Äù a resident of PM Palem said

title: Kerala Waqf Board to challenge HC Division Bench‚Äôs verdict on Munambam land
content: A two-member Bench consisting of Justice Sushrut Arvind Dharmadhikari and Justice V. M. Shyamkumar had passed the judgment last month in a writ petition filed by the State government challenging a Single Judge‚Äôs order striking down the appointment of an inquiry commission into the Munambam issue.

title: First Juvenile Huntington‚Äôs Disease brain donated to NIMHANS for research
content: The deceased, Jagadeesha, who was 12, hailed from Kalagotla village in Yemmiganur mandal of Kurnool district, Andhra Pradesh, was first evaluated at NIMHANS in 2017

title: Coimbatore gang rape: Police arrest three men after shooting them in legs
content: Coimbatore City Police Commissioner A. Saravana Sundar said the trio was in an inebriated condition when they committed the crime. Two of them, who are siblings, have murder and theft cases pending against them.

title: Bihar Assembly polls LIVE: U.P. CM Adityanath holds roadshow in Darbhanga; Mallikarjun Kharge slams NDA Govt on safety of women
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge slammed the BJP-JD(U) over the security situation for women in Bihar and asserted that the Mahagathbandhan is fully committed to their empowerment and economic upliftment.

title: ‚ÄòDemands to be discussed with CM within 15 days‚Äô: Jain monk ends indefinite fast over pigeon feeding issue in Mumbai
content: After the Bombay HC order, the BMC recently allowed controlled feeding of pigeons at four locations ‚Äî Worli Reservoir, the mangrove area on Lokhandwala Back Road in Andheri West, the Airoli-Mulund check post area, and Gorai ground in Borivali West

title: CM Bhupendra Patel visits rain-affected Gujarat villages, reviews crop damage
content: Unseasonal rains that began in the last week of October damaged crops in several districts. Survey operations were launched to assess the extent of damage

title: Coimbatore gang rape: a hang-out for anti-social elements that turned into crime scene
content: The vacant areas along a mud road linking Brindhavan Nagar and SIHS Colony have become a hotspot for drinking, substance abuse: residents

title: Haryana cabinet approves job support for families of 1984 anti-Sikh riot victims
content: In another decision, the cabinet approved the Teachers' Transfer Policy, 2025, replacing the existing Teachers' Transfer Policy, 2023

title: Restructuring of Panjab University‚Äôs senate-syndicate has exposed ‚ÄòBJP‚Äôs anti-Punjab face‚Äô, says ex-Cong min
content: Mr. Sidhu stated that under the pretext of improving the functioning of Panjab University, the Central government has almost eliminated the representation of teachers, principals, and alumni in its syndicate

title: Dynastic politics 'grave threat' to Indian democracy: Shashi Tharoor
content: Mr. Tharoor said that when political power is determined by lineage rather than ability, commitment, or grassroots engagement, the quality of governance suffers

title: Bihar Assembly polls: Modi invokes katta jibe again, Priyanka slams PM, Kharge says Nitish ‚Äòin BJP‚Äôs lap‚Äô
